title: Job Vacancies at Beebeejump
content:
Beebeejump is a Renewable Energy company specialized in providing efficient and affordable electricity at different scale. We meet the electricity needs of household and all strata of businesses through our Pay as you go structure, improving quality of life and providing access to 24/7 electricity.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Finance Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Monitor any discrepancies in payment made to the company.
	Organize a financial filing system that is easily accessible.
	Perform data analysis and advise senior managers on profit making.
	Track all payments made for tax preparation and follow up on returns.
	Ensure that all clients follows proper financial payment mode.
	Ensure accuracy of financial statements, making sure that the final figures on statements are correct.
	Assist with the balancing of the office/department budget.
	Helps in the utilization of funds.
	Determination of capital structure.
	Maintaining financial stability and sustainability
	Maintain day to day finance function


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree/HND in Accountancy, Economics, Finance or any related field
	Must reside in areas close Ojodu, Berger, Ogba, Ikeja, Agege, Ojota, Ketu,
	Proven work experience as a Finance Manager.
	Minimum 8years experience in Finance Management.
	Proficient in all accounting tools and apps.
	Detail-oriented.
	Excellent communication skills.
	The ability to work under pressure
	Sound organizational skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N400,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: hr@beebeejump.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Business Development Manager 

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities (B2B)
	Manage sales pipeline and convert leads into sales
	Build strategic partnerships and distribution networks
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis
	Prepare and present proposals and solutions to clients
	Meet and exceed monthly sales targets


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Engineering, or related field
	Proven sales or business development experience (solar/energy sector preferred)
	Strong negotiation and presentation skills
	Passion for clean energy and sustainability
	Willingness to travel for business meetings.


Salary
N600,000 - N800,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 12th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: hr@beebeejump.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) After Sales Engineer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Responsible for product repair, testing and maintenance to ensure functionality.
	Able to read and interpret electronic circuit diagrams and analyze faults based on these diagrams.
	Proficient in using soldering iron and other repair tools to solder and replace motherboard hardware.
	Communicate with customers and technical team to address aftersales technical issues.
	Maintain detailed service logs and reports.
	Coordinate with the engineering team for system checks and upgrades.
	Familiar with the Installation of both on-grid and off-grid solar installation


Requirements / Qualifications


	Graduate of Electrical/Electronics Engineering or any course in related field.
	Minimum 1 years of practical experience as an Aftersales Engineer in a solar company.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Willing to do on-site/field works.
	Excellent time management, Communication and customer relationship management skill.
	Familiar with electric circuit faults.


Salary
N120,000 - N350,000 / month

Application Closing Date: 12th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed CV to: hr@beebeejump.com using "After Sales Engineers" as the subject of the email.

	Fitlife Caf&eacute; is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented&nbsp;Caf&eacute; Manager&nbsp;to oversee daily operations, ensure exceptional customer service, and maintain high standards of food safety, cleanliness, and team performance.

	Open the caf&eacute; by 6:00 AM and ensure all staff are punctual and properly dressed.

Employment Type: Full-time
Reports To: Business Owners

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Fitlife Café is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Café Manager to oversee daily operations, ensure exceptional customer service, and maintain high standards of food safety, cleanliness, and team performance.
	The ideal candidate will have strong leadership skills, be tech-savvy (particularly with Microsoft Office), and possess a passion for healthy living and hospitality excellence.


Key Responsibilities
Daily Operations


	Open the café by 6:00 AM and ensure all staff are punctual and properly dressed.
	Supervise product preparation and ensure timely delivery to corporate clients (e.g., Seplat and Total).
	Monitor all digital platforms (Chowdeck, Glovo, Fitlife website) for product availability and order flow.
	Ensure all orders are processed within 15 minutes and dispatched promptly using approved logistics partners.


Team Management


	Enforce staff compliance with hygiene, dress code, and conduct standards.
	Conduct uniform checks and ensure proper use of face masks and head coverings.
	Oversee training of new hires and ensure health clearance before food handling.
	Address and report staff misconduct or insubordination immediately.


Customer Service


	Ensure staff deliver excellent customer service and adhere to the approved phone greeting script.
	Handle customer complaints professionally and escalate issues when necessary.
	Evaluate refund or replacement requests, consulting owners when required.


Inventory & Reconciliation


	Conduct daily inventory checks and reconcile with back-office records.
	Report spoilage and discrepancies to owners with justification.
	Monitor stock levels and coordinate timely restocking (2 weeks ahead for imported items).
	Reconcile POS, Paystack, and cooperative payments with the accountant.


End-of-Day Duties


	Begin closing procedures by 6:30 PM and ensure café is locked and secured by 8:00 PM.
	Supervise end-of-day inventory count and set production targets for the next day.
	Ensure cleanliness of all equipment, fridges, and workspaces before closing.


Technology & Reporting


	Use Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) for reporting and reconciliation.
	Utilize Canva, AI tools, and social media platforms for content creation and customer engagement.
	Maintain accurate records of sales, inventory, and staff performance.

	Minimum OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality, Business Administration, or related field.
	At least 2 years of experience in a supervisory or managerial role within the food service industry.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook) is mandatory.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and maintain a positive team environment.


Conduct Expectations


	Maintain a professional and respectful work environment.
	Avoid loud conversations and over-familiarity with gym members or instructors.

Working Hours & Flexibility


	Standard Shift: 6:00 AM – 7:00 PM (Monday to Saturday).
	Flexibility: Extended hours, overtime, and public holidays may be required based on business needs.

title: Job Openings at Kinz Global Consult
content:
Kinz Global Consult is an HR Consulting agency that works in staffing and recruitment. We match the employers and employees after reviewing and scrutinizing their needs, nature of work, and cost-effectiveness. We provide professional and competent staff for companies, corporate or non-corporate. We also provide temporary or contractual services on certain conditions and provide permanent staff on demand. 

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) QA Tester / QA Engineer (IT Space)

Job Location: Lagos (Fully Remote)
Employment Type: Contract (One-month Contract)

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Design and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test data for both frontend and backend components.
	Verify data accuracy, consistency, and integrity across ingestion, processing, storage, and reporting layers.
	Collaborate with developers, analysts, and product managers to understand requirements and ensure test coverage.
	Conduct API testing for backend services (REST/GraphQL) to ensure reliability and data correctness.
	Validate UI workflows, ensuring smooth user interaction and accurate representation of backend data.
	Identify, log, and track defects through their lifecycle, and provide clear documentation for debugging.
	Implement automated tests where appropriate (UI, API, and data validation)
	Perform performance and load testing on key data workflows and system endpoints.
	Support release validation by conducting regression, smoke, and end-to-end testing. Requirements


Requirements


	(3–5+ years) in software QA or test engineering.
	Strong background in testing data-intensive applications, ETL processes, or analytics/reporting platforms.
	Proficiency with SQL (queries, joins, aggregations) to validate data integrity across databases.
	Experience testing REST APIs (e.g., Postman, REST Assured, Karate, etc.).
	Familiarity with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright, JUnit, TestNG).
	Strong understanding of data validation techniques and business rule testing.
	Hands-on experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQL Server, etc.).


Skills:


	Familiarity with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Superset).
	Experience with automated testing tools
	Exposure to performance/load testing tools (JMeter, Gatling, k6).
	Experience with data governance and quality frameworks.


Application Closing Date: 25th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cv@kinzglobalconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Java (Spring Boot) Engineer

Job Location: Lagos (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

Reponsibilities


	Build Java-based ETL and ELT pipelines to extract, transform, and load source systems.
	Extracting data from source systems.
	Cleaning and transforming the data for analytics.
	Loading it efficiently into a ClickHouse data warehouse.
	Structure data pipelines using ELT principles.
	Develop efficient, well-tested, and reusable Java (Spring Boot) backend services along with other development team members to query, organize, and expose processed data through Spring Boot APIs.
	Collaborate with frontend and analytics teams to ensure the data layer supports dashboard visualizations and alerts
	Integration of user-facing elements developed by front-end and mobile app engineer.
	Collaborate with other team members in brainstorming sessions to define, design, test, and ship application features.
	Identify, correct bottlenecks and fix bugs on new and existing applications.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications.
	3 - 4 years of experience in a similar role.
	Strong experience with Java, especially in Spring Boot for service development.
	Strong experience building ETL/ELT pipelines and working with data integration.
	Solid understanding of SQL, data modeling, and analytical querying.
	Familiarity with APIs, JSON, and integrating external systems.
	Comfortable with version control (Git) and collaborative development practices.


Nice-to-Have / Big Advantage:


	Nice-to-Have / Bonus Skills.
	Exposure to predictive modeling with Python is a big advantage.
	Familiarity with ClickHouse or other columnar databases.
	AWS/cloud deployment experience.


Application Closing Date: 28th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@kinzglobalconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Live-in House Help

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Sweeping, mopping, dusting, and vacuuming to remove dirt, debris, and dust from floors and other surfaces.
	Washing windows and walls, as well as polishing woodwork as needed.
	Scrubbing toilets, showers, baths, and bathroom sinks as well as removing mildew buildup and mold from various surfaces.
	Wiping down kitchen appliances, equipment, and counters to remove dirt, grease, and grime.
	Regularly empty wastebaskets and dispose of all rubbish.
	Washing, drying, and folding bedding and towels.
	Maintaining an accurate record of all cleaning tasks completed each day.
	Laundering clothing as required.


Requirements


	Minimum of Primary School Certificate and SSCE.
	1- 2 years of house helping experience.
	Sound knowledge of different cleaning methods.
	The ability to work with minimal supervision.
	The ability to multitask.
	Excellent organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills.
	Effective communication skills.


Application Closing Date: 27th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CVs to: cv@kinzglobalconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
